body_html: @zdevito The old constructor default-initializes all members and then overwrites them in the swap. The new version doesn't default-initialize them but directly initializes them with the correct values, which is (in theory) a bit faster.
body_text: @zdevito The old constructor default-initializes all members and then overwrites them in the swap. The new version doesn't default-initialize them but directly initializes them with the correct values, which is (in theory) a bit faster.
body: @zdevito The old constructor default-initializes all members and then overwrites them in the swap. The new version doesn't default-initialize them but directly initializes them with the correct values, which is (in theory) a bit faster.
